newsitem.title: USA: Aris Industries says buys Davco assets.
newsitem.headline: Aris Industries says buys Davco assets.

text.p: Aris Industries Inc. said Monday it acquired assets from Davco Industries Inc., a maker of men's and boy's wear under the Perry Ellis, Perry Ellis America and Jeffrey Banks labels, for about $1.8 million in stock and other payments.
Aris bought the assets from Davco's principals, Steven Arnold and Christopher Healy.

The purchase price consists of 3 million shares of Aris common stock, constituting about 20 percent of Aris' outstanding shares, plus a cash payment based on the performance of the acquired businesses in 1997.

The new business will be operated by ECI Sportswear Inc., a unit of Aris' Europe Craft Imports Inc. subsidiary. Arnold will be president and Healy will be chief operating officer of ECI Sportswear Inc.
They will report to Charles Ramat, chairman of Aris and ECI.
